content:
Posted: June 1, 2015
												Most of the issues I previously had with the game (you can read them below) have been adressed and the game is good now!It has been dumbed down immenselyI am a huge Magicka fan and it pains me to have to write a negative review of this game, but at this stage we need to shock the developers into listening.The issues of this game have been pointed out many times over in other reviews but I will summarize them once more. Dumbed down casting system - The developers didn't listen when people told them that making steam and ice not combine was a bad idea during the sneak peak. Sure some combos were op in Magicka 1, but they were complex spells that required many key presses to execute and of course they were optional. Yeah you might have gone through the entirety of Magicka 1 by spamming broken pillars of icy death, but then again how do you go through Magicka 2? You spam arcane rocks on your head or use arcane fire beams. A much worse substitute for the previously "broken spells" in my opinion. There are no elaborate combos worth doing in this one.Projectiles are no longer viable because it take a ridiculous amount of time to charge them up and cast them. No one uses them any more, because why the hell would they, after all this game wants you to only use arcane fire beams and area spam.Mines are no longer viable because they do too little damage and explode automatically.You can't turn lightning into a beam now lightning is not really good for anything but making EAASF storms for your enemies to pass through, which are not even really worth the effort since arcane fire beams and area are faster to cast and more versatile. If you thought going through the first game spamming super steam beam and lightning ice was bad, just wait till you go through this one casting nothing but arcane fire.The unnecessary global cooldown on magicks - I really don't understand why this was implemented, players with fast fingers should be rewarded for their skill, not be slowed down to the speed of someone with a controller. We are PC gamers we don't care about controller equality. I can understand the desire to remove spamming magicks that insta kill your enemies too fast, but making a global magick cooldown is not the correct fix to that, first of all there are no insta kill magicks in this one and second at least make the cooldown per magick only not global!People like to complain about the magicks hotbar, but I really think it's a good idea, you don't have to use it if you think it makes things too easy and it's there to help people who aren't that great at memorizing complex magick recipes, but the help should have ended there, the real problem is that they decided to stop rewarding players who made the effort of learning to fastcast magicks and thus they slammed the skill cap into the ground.  No active abilities on staves and other issues with them - This is just lazy, staves in this game simply nerf and buff elements, effectively making them less diverse and the fact that the skull staff and helviti staff are so powerful makes all the other ones useless. You can no longer choose a staff simply because you like how it looks, now you have to optimise for most damage, since you are generally underpowered (explained in my previous two points).Robes only shuffle around resistances - which if you are playing on bananas means absolutely nothing, so this leaves only one robe worth using which is wuxia because of it's speed buff, since that is the only stat that really helps with anything.There are too few boss fights - the first game had many memorable boss fights that were unique and fun. This one has only one - at the end of the game.You fly too much - It is annoying that the single most powerful enemy in this game is knockback, gl with those little bomber goblins while you are fighting the grenade launcher orcs. Oh and there is no way to reduce this effect significantly and you can't conjure elements in mid air. Most of your deaths in this game will be flying off the map.The skill cap bar is so low James Cameron needs to go under and pull it back up.Overall the game is challenging and fun, it has a good story, nice humor and is enjoyable to play, but it doesn‚Äôt reward skill or playstyle diversity. I had a lot of fun with it but some of the desition making behind a lot of the mechanics changes must have resembled this: 


YouTube‚Ñ¢ Video: South Park - American Economics¬†

			Views: 784,328		



 pretty closely. The sort of ‚Äúbalance‚Äù changes that were implemented are not really necessary in a singleplayer/co-op game where people can choose the way they play. I really hope some fixes get implemented pretty soon and I would more that happily give this game a thumbs up if things change. I don't really understand why they had to work so hard toward evening out keyboard and mouse vs controller by punishing keyboard and mouse players, the game isn‚Äôt even cross platform‚Ä¶ wtf? These sort of artificial nefs (inability to combine elements,cooldowns on magicks, lightning being useless) could have been optional, through artifacts. If you are one of those people who would justify the changes with ‚Äúyou are no longer overpowered‚Äù try the ESSSS DSSSS selfcast spam combo in Magicka 2.I think Magicka 2 should have been released as early access game, with large amounts of openmindedness and willingness to listen from the developer's side. I know that this is most likely paradoxes fault, even though I have a lot of respect for them as a publisher I think they forced this one out a little too fast for it's own good.If you ever fix these problems, a way to incentivise your players to play with these unholy nerfs would be to have artefact set achievements.I hope this review helped you make a more informed decision about your purchase and I really hope I have reason to change it to positive soon! Please listen to our cries developers!Oh and why on earth would you call arcane death? Just wondering.I love you Magicka but you need some tough love.

content:
Posted: May 26, 2015
 [EDITED]  I have never been so disappointed in a game.  Magicka 2 is a huge let down and that genuinely makes me sad. As I understand it, the game is based on Wizard Wars rather than the original Magicka. Why? You tell me, Paradox! What this means is that we get an extremely simplified version of the original spell-casting-system, which in return straight up REMOVES some of the fun combos you used to be able to do, rather than expanding the fun with more elements and combinations. To explain what I'm yappin' about I'll give you an example: In the first game you were able to combine arcane, ice, snow, lightning, steam and shields in order to create pillars of death and total destruction. However, in Magicka 2 you can't combine two elements in order to make a new one, e.g. water + fire = steam. Instead, if you want steam, you gotta have fire and water separate in you bar which also means that you can't add lightning since it will cancel out the water, etc. Also, you can't add additional fire/water in order to make a stream which contains BOTH steam and fire/water. Now you only get steam... This new logic applies to basically everything similar, meaning; electrifying arcane-icicles fueled by scolding steam are a big  NOPE . Instead of being able to combine different elements in order to perform an ability like you used to be able to do, they've replaced it with on-demand-quick-buttons (not the official term) which automatically cast your spells for you. This new and incredibly boring system also requires your spells to have cooldowns. In short, the days of ferociously spamming tornadoes and endless waves of pure inferno are over. (EDIT: My mistake, you are still able to spam abilities if you conjure them by combining elements, but I still think the quick-cast-thingy ruins the fun.)Before you go on about how unbalanced the original Magicka was: IT WAS THE WHOLE POINT. Being able to one-shot basically everything was not only hilarious but also perfectly fine, since you could easily kill yourself as well if you didn't know what you were doing.  "When everyone's OP, no one's OP."                                                                - MeTo be fair, the game has improved in some areas, like the graphics and... That's pretty much it actually. Sure, now there are artifacts and companions and all that mumbo-jumbo, but rather than improving the game they're dumbing it down even further. It's really hard to appreciate everything the game does right when it does SOOO much wrong in other aspects (I'm still talking about the new spell system). If they just would have kept the original system it actually would have been fine, but since they didn't... Yeah...I feel like I've completely wasted my money on what was supposed to be an amazing game. If you still wanna buy it, be my guest, you might like it. But if you love the original like I do you will without question be disappointed (but hey, I might be wrong).I rate Magicka 2  3/10 .What do you guys think?(VERY IMPORTANT EDIT: They fixed everything and the game is now pretty damn dank... Yaaay!)New Rating:  7,5/10  Whoop Whoop

												Magicka 2 is a huge let down for fans of the first game for several reasons and the game is such a chore solo that it made me take a break after 2 hours (that AND the fact that the game lost connection to the server 3 times and froze on some weird "Better hit ALT+F4" screen).1) The movement is horrible. While the devs made it easier to move and prepare spells instead of the awful Finger Twister game from the first one; You now must go where you click ALWAYS. Aim with the mouse, judge distance on lightning spells with the mouse, walk right off a cliff with the mouse. Why the devs felt the need to add slippery ice mechanics ON TOP OF THIS I have no idea.2) The spells were weakened INCREDIBLY. You now need to play co-op in order to deal the same damage as the first game but the enemies have roughly the same health. One of the features I noticed first is that shields are no longer worth casting in any way, never again will your "E" key stand alone. You can't mash space to maintain (which is weird because that sounds like a HUGE co-op feature) and if you try to keep up a personal shield, you won't have time to cast anything else. Your spamming of spells is also gone. I prided myself on my ability to mash out a quick Lightning Bolt in Magicka but now, even without the awful "focus regeneration" on your quick-cast spells, each spell has a cool-down that serves to hamper players who have memorized casting spells quickly since you move slower when preparing a spell and there is no "negate casting" button.3) Quick-casting is a nice option but you cannot program your own spells. If I could set my "1" key to quick-cast a ward or full strength heal, this complaint wouldn't be on the list. The devs feel like they can tell you how to play the game they just handed and marketed as having all these cooky spell combinations (which you don't unlock quickly nor do the original interactions carry over; instead they dumbed down the game for controller support) by forcing certain spells into the "1", "2", "3", &"4" keys and not even allowing you to rebind those to different numbers.4) After the devs go and dismiss DRMs in  this article: http://www.gamespot.com/articles/why-drm-sucks-according-to-magicka-developer-parad/1100-6420910/You later find out that if you disconnect from the Paradox servers, the game kicks you out.-EDIT-Most of the issues listed have been fixed and while I don't think the developers should be let off the hook for their poor decisions, I do think they deserve some credit for their responsiveness. I am once again finding myself enjoying and reccomemending this game and its additions.

The goodIt's the new Magicka! Having Magicka 1 behind it, Magicka 2 couldn't fail(at least, that is what I thought before).Graphics Graphics are vastly improved, everything is smoother.Humor and references Humor is good. It makes you laugh.Friendly fire Friendly fire is always activated and you can not disable it. Fantastic for losing friends(if you have friends that bought Magicka 2 and want to play it)The badSpell casting system is limited Here is why:* Lightning does not form a beam when combined with arcane => Ruins wet-run away-fire lightning + arcane from distance tactic* Shields only block elementary damage => No chaos on the screenMagick system is copied from Magicka: Wizard Wars You have 4 magicks available at the moment and the game encourages you to click their buttons in the quick bar to activate them. They also have a temporary cooldown. This is bypassed by equipping a staff that regenerates your mana quickly. You can manually enter element combination and activate magicks that way, but the whole magick system feels nerfed.The game forces you to play with friends Enemies are too hard to beat if you are playing solo, a single goblin hits you three times and you are dead. In some cases, you need to interact with some parts of the level and fight enemies at the same time. It's simply too hard to play alone. What if I don't have friends that want to play Magicka 2?Final wordsMagicka 2 is inferior to Magicka 1 in every way except graphics and stability.If you have not bought Magicka 2 yet, buy Magicka 1, beat it, than play Magicka: Wizard Wars. If you like it, buy Magicka 2. Otherwise, stay away from Magicka 2.

												Magicka 2. You can see an unpleasant amount of negative reviews. And yes, they've got a great point. Magicka 2 feels like an expansion to Magicka. People compare these two a lot. And I mean A LOT. Yes, the campaign is fairly short and there are quite harder enemies.But, you mostly can't see them mentioning to use the new mechanics. The enemies are hard, yes, however if you use the new movement system to your advantage, they become much easier. It is hard to get used to, don't be mislead, but once you get the hang of it, you fly (not literally). People dislike the fact that now you can't SPAM. Yes, literally. You cannot spam the same op spell combo for the whole game. You have to differ your attacks. And people hate it. Enemies have elemental resistances which, in my opinion, is a great thing. You now have to use different combinations and A-S-S (lightning-death-death) or A-R-S-E (lightning-cold-death-shield) are not the way to go the whole campaign. And the thing about magicks having a global cooldown? Meh. I don't mind.In conclusion people got so used to Magicka, they cannot accept the new mechanics. And look at how much time most people that reviwed negatively have put in the game! Less than me! (and I don't have much) It is a matter of adaptation. If you adapt to this game, you will love it (especially if you are new to the Magicka "franchise"). But if you can't adapt to this new thing, then you won't enjoy it. And you won't find out until you have bought the game (lols). I really recommend you adapt to this system. And if you do, I can almost guarantee you will enjoy the game :-)

												Most of the issues I previously had with the game (you can read them below) have been adressed and the game is good now!It has been dumbed down immenselyI am a huge Magicka fan and it pains me to have to write a negative review of this game, but at this stage we need to shock the developers into listening.The issues of this game have been pointed out many times over in other reviews but I will summarize them once more. Dumbed down casting system - The developers didn't listen when people told them that making steam and ice not combine was a bad idea during the sneak peak. Sure some combos were op in Magicka 1, but they were complex spells that required many key presses to execute and of course they were optional. Yeah you might have gone through the entirety of Magicka 1 by spamming broken pillars of icy death, but then again how do you go through Magicka 2? You spam arcane rocks on your head or use arcane fire beams. A much worse substitute for the previously "broken spells" in my opinion. There are no elaborate combos worth doing in this one.Projectiles are no longer viable because it take a ridiculous amount of time to charge them up and cast them. No one uses them any more, because why the hell would they, after all this game wants you to only use arcane fire beams and area spam.Mines are no longer viable because they do too little damage and explode automatically.You can't turn lightning into a beam now lightning is not really good for anything but making EAASF storms for your enemies to pass through, which are not even really worth the effort since arcane fire beams and area are faster to cast and more versatile. If you thought going through the first game spamming super steam beam and lightning ice was bad, just wait till you go through this one casting nothing but arcane fire.The unnecessary global cooldown on magicks - I really don't understand why this was implemented, players with fast fingers should be rewarded for their skill, not be slowed down to the speed of someone with a controller. We are PC gamers we don't care about controller equality. I can understand the desire to remove spamming magicks that insta kill your enemies too fast, but making a global magick cooldown is not the correct fix to that, first of all there are no insta kill magicks in this one and second at least make the cooldown per magick only not global!People like to complain about the magicks hotbar, but I really think it's a good idea, you don't have to use it if you think it makes things too easy and it's there to help people who aren't that great at memorizing complex magick recipes, but the help should have ended there, the real problem is that they decided to stop rewarding players who made the effort of learning to fastcast magicks and thus they slammed the skill cap into the ground.  No active abilities on staves and other issues with them - This is just lazy, staves in this game simply nerf and buff elements, effectively making them less diverse and the fact that the skull staff and helviti staff are so powerful makes all the other ones useless. You can no longer choose a staff simply because you like how it looks, now you have to optimise for most damage, since you are generally underpowered (explained in my previous two points).Robes only shuffle around resistances - which if you are playing on bananas means absolutely nothing, so this leaves only one robe worth using which is wuxia because of it's speed buff, since that is the only stat that really helps with anything.There are too few boss fights - the first game had many memorable boss fights that were unique and fun. This one has only one - at the end of the game.You fly too much - It is annoying that the single most powerful enemy in this game is knockback, gl with those little bomber goblins while you are fighting the grenade launcher orcs. Oh and there is no way to reduce this effect significantly and you can't conjure elements in mid air. Most of your deaths in this game will be flying off the map.The skill cap bar is so low James Cameron needs to go under and pull it back up.Overall the game is challenging and fun, it has a good story, nice humor and is enjoyable to play, but it doesn‚Äôt reward skill or playstyle diversity. I had a lot of fun with it but some of the desition making behind a lot of the mechanics changes must have resembled this: 


YouTube‚Ñ¢ Video: South Park - American Economics¬†

			Views: 784,328		



 pretty closely. The sort of ‚Äúbalance‚Äù changes that were implemented are not really necessary in a singleplayer/co-op game where people can choose the way they play. I really hope some fixes get implemented pretty soon and I would more that happily give this game a thumbs up if things change. I don't really understand why they had to work so hard toward evening out keyboard and mouse vs controller by punishing keyboard and mouse players, the game isn‚Äôt even cross platform‚Ä¶ wtf? These sort of artificial nefs (inability to combine elements,cooldowns on magicks, lightning being useless) could have been optional, through artifacts. If you are one of those people who would justify the changes with ‚Äúyou are no longer overpowered‚Äù try the ESSSS DSSSS selfcast spam combo in Magicka 2.I think Magicka 2 should have been released as early access game, with large amounts of openmindedness and willingness to listen from the developer's side. I know that this is most likely paradoxes fault, even though I have a lot of respect for them as a publisher I think they forced this one out a little too fast for it's own good.If you ever fix these problems, a way to incentivise your players to play with these unholy nerfs would be to have artefact set achievements.I hope this review helped you make a more informed decision about your purchase and I really hope I have reason to change it to positive soon! Please listen to our cries developers!Oh and why on earth would you call arcane death? Just wondering.I love you Magicka but you need some tough love.

												Coming from player of first game of the series, a short word on how i feel about the game.It tried to continue both Magicka and the Wisard Wars, which were 2 completely different games as concepts. Result: most spells and magicks got reworked, for example, no more qerasr for me and key combination for teleport magicka is changed so it's not as easily spammable as in the first game. Furthermore, game introduced cooldowns on magickas, so here comes another limiter. But other than that, the spell system stayed almosth the same (or similar enough) and the fact that it can now actually be played in co-op seals the deal (also, overal movement got better(and gamepad controlls which actually make sense)).Story is.... Well, the style of jokes in this game compared to the first one is worse imo. Though it might be just that my sense of humor changed over... how much was that? over the time between those 2 games being released. The spoiler-ish part of the story rable:  it went too hard on my feelings. I feel real sympathy towards antagonist of our 4 heroes. And that's basically the reason I didn't touch the game since I completed most of the achievements. Would I recommend this game? It's alright. Not briliant, not as innovative as the first one, but certainly more polished, in some areas more that it should've been though.

content:
Posted: March 7, 2016
												last year I played this after release with great anticipation expecting more ridiculous, overpowered spell fun with my friends and unfortunately this game fell leauges short of its predecessor. While admittedly some gameplay aspects from the previous title were improved upon such as permament gear for your player and movement while casting I have seen way too many problems to make this a worthwhile buy.First off, with the rebalance of spells from the first game what I have noticed is even on the easy preset this game is nigh unplayable on your own. the various spells we have come to memorize and love from the first installment have been nerfed to hell and back, leaving damage output to be paltry at best even when exploiting the "weaknesses" of certain enemies.Secondly, the protective spells from the first game have been rendered nearly useless. the Shift+E bubble sheild that many people have come to rely on to catch a quick breather from a fight is extremely fragile and cannot be bolstered by spamming space. Aside from this, multi resistance armor such as the FDSE combination favored in the first game have no use on the battlefeild, having near no protective properties left to it and the pure rock armor that seems to have replaced it is usually gone within 5 or so hits from your basic enemies, couple this with swarm tactics and an apparent increased damage output to the common enemy and you have spelled death for the player.I dearly hope that the complaints I have and those from other players are given consideration here, we all would hate to see what could have been a game that could have surpassed the original Magicka go the way of Leviathan: Warships, dropped like a hot brick.

content:
Posted: May 27, 2016
												Part of the appeal of Magicka 1 for me was how deadly and volatile it was to play when it first came out.  You could pretty much cast the advanced spells as fast as your fingers could rattle out the combos, and now cooldowns (can't let Magicka get too chaotic!) and quick slots (no need to flex the APM so much!  Also, cast Haste while wet) have taken the edge off that.  You were often one element and a second away from getting squished, and now you can respawn, press W, A then space over and over while you think of what to do next.  It's like a lot of the fun's been balanced out of it.The campaign is a lot duller and shorter than Magicka 1's too.  It's less mechanically inventive (less interesting fights and environmental interaction) and aesthetically imaginative (less visual variety).All that said, I enjoyed it enough to finish the campaign, but I only recommend this if you've wrung out Magicka already.

The spoiler-ish part of the story rable:  it went too hard on my feelings. I feel real sympathy towards antagonist of our 4 heroes. And that's basically the reason I didn't touch the game since I completed most of the achievements. Would I recommend this game? It's alright. Not briliant, not as innovative as the first one, but certainly more polished, in some areas more that it should've been though.
